Through original programming, documentaries, and expert-led discussions, MHTN aims to increase awareness, provide valuable information, and encourage open conversations about mental well-being.

programme.title: Quo Vadis TV
programme.desc: Quo Vadis TV is committed to sharing the Biblical message in a way that makes Christian living practical, realistic, and attainable. Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Contestants from Georgia and California try their luck in hope of winning $1 million.

programme.desc: Hotels that are fit for a prince or princess in the passionate and warm locale of Monaco; Venice, Italy's largest urban car-free area, features 15th century buildings and ancient courtyards.

programme.title: Dream Cruises
programme.desc: With 780 cabins and accommodations to more than 1,500 passengers, the elegant Italian MSC Lirica will cruise the West Indies; ports-of-call are Dominican Republic, Saint Martin, Martinique, Guadeloupe, Antigua, and Tortola.

programme.title: Road Less Traveled
programme.desc: After a leisurely bike ride around scenic Amsterdam and the Dutch countryside, Jonathan sticks out a thumb and catches a class E 400 meter long container ship en route to Morocco.

programme.title: Distant Shores
programme.desc: Sheryl and Paul Shard voyage to exotic destinations.

programme.title: Top Travel
programme.desc: The duo rent a couple of Fiat's and explore Rome.

programme.title: 5 Star Getaways
programme.desc: This series is a sun-filled invitation to travel and visit magnificent all-inclusive 5 star resorts throughout the world, their magnificent surroundings and the exciting excursions one can do at each destination.

programme.title: Tasting America
programme.desc: Austin, Texas is a musical city known for its bustling cultural communities, but today we're diving right into the heart of Austin's best food scenes!

programme.title: Fight to Survive
programme.desc: A rock-climbing disaster hurtles climber Craig DeMartino 100 feet down a granite cliff. A shattered heap of broken bones, Craig clings to life. In a split second, Craig's life becomes an inspiring fight to survive.

programme.desc: Children are the future -- and so are their inventions, which is why "Think Big" could be an important show. It features young inventors competing to see who can come up with the most-innovative invention. programme.title: America's Heartland
programme.desc: Much of the food Americans eat is produced by farmers and ranchers in the country's heartland, but many people don't know how it's produced. "America's Heartland" provides information about the people and processes responsible for the availability of food and fuel across the country and around the world. The show's reporters and producers tell stories in topics that include farm families, consumer issues, animal welfare and crop sustainability. Some episodes also take the show abroad to countries such as Egypt and Taiwan to show the impact American agriculture has on the global economy.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E3 The Argonauts Cheyenne tries to help two prospectors locate a gold mine after Indians kill their partner, who knew the mine's location. Cheyenne finds the gold, but greed and distrust take over the prospectors, causing major issues.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E4 Border Showdown Cheyenne and Smitty travel to Mexico to bring a gang of outlaws accused of killing Cheyenne's close friend to justice. However, after they arrive, they discover that the small Mexican town is under the rule of the gang's leader.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E12 Feet of Clay Little Billy Allen's mother has died so he waits for his father at the Cartwrights. Unknown to Billy, his father is a prisoner who has broken out of jail. When the father commits robbery and murder, Hoss is forced to kill him.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E27 The Lariat Lariat Jones, an old friend of Lucas', comes to North Fork to open up a new gambling casino. Jones has an excellent reputation as an honest gambler. But when two strangers become his partners, accusations of cheating become deadly for Jones.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E28 Smoke Screen A beautiful headstrong young woman named Marge Crandell doesn't like to be told what to do by anyone. Several men vie for her attention and when Lucas finds her dead, one of the men becomes a prime suspect due to a simple clue, a half-smoked cigar.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E29 Shotgun Man Lucas receives several mysterious threatening notes. He discovers they are being sent from ex-convict, John Beaumont, who is bent on revenge. Beaumont wants Lucas dead since he is the one responsible for his imprisonment.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E30 Sins of the Father Andy Moon and his young son, Bobby, take shelter at the McCain Ranch. Andy killed a man in a gunfight in self-defense. Now, the man's brothers are after Moon. Complications arise when Bobby discovers the truth about their running from town to town.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Friend Zone A shipment from Faith Cattle Company is in jeopardy when the truck gets stuck in a ditch. It's a race against the clock to get the cattle to the buyer or risk losing the deal. Bubba teams up with his father-in-law to build a custom grill prototype in hopes of launching a new business venture. Cody decides to sell a horse to help fund his dream home, but he receives an offer that is less than ideal. After getting relationship advice from Bubba and Cody, Booger ends up on a date with his best friend Ashley.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E5 Is It a Boy or a Girl? Before heading out for the day's work, Bubba notices one of his colts is missing, and the guys go searching for the young horse before it is injured. At the urging of his grandmother, Booger ventures into the world of Internet dating, hoping to find a serious girlfriend. After Bubba's trusted horse gets sick, he asks Booger to help him break in a new colt. Cody and Misty finally find out if they are having a little cowboy or cowgirl, and they plan a party to reveal the gender to friends and family.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E5 Death Never Rides Alone A former gunfighter comes to North Fork with the intention of settling down and starting a new life. Many resent him but Lucas helps him. However, outlaws come to town and threaten to cause trouble with the retired gunman.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E6 I Take This Woman Irishman Dennis O'Flarrety arrives in North Fork and announces he is there to marry Lou Mallory. Years ago, Lou's father promised her hand to O'Flarrety in marriage. Lou, however, doesn't seem to like him, and her reasons are soon revealed.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E1 They Killed Me Frontiersman Jim Bridger spins an incredible tale to a group of settlers, claiming he was once killed by Blackfeet warriors yet somehow lived to tell the tale. They think he's joking, but Bridger soon proves that he really did rise from the dead.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E4 Brothers in Arms When they are ambushed by a Blackfeet war party, Jim Bridger and a lone Shoshone brave must work together to find a way to defeat their common enemy. If they can't overcome their suspicions and learn to trust each other, they may not survive the day.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E1 The Bone War It's not gold that inspires a rush of treasure hunters to flood the windblown bluffs of Wyoming: it's bones. After stumbling upon a strange fossil, a man is caught in the crossfire of rival paleontologists warring over a trove of dinosaur bones.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E8 The Gold Rush Lawman When failed prospector John Hicks Adams is elected sheriff of Santa Clara County, he must prove that he won't be a bust as a lawman too. Just weeks into the job, his courage is tested when a band of stagecoach robbers begins terrorizing the area.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S2 E6 Tom Fitzpatrick: Steadfast Frontiersman By the 1840s, the fur trade is ending, forcing lifelong frontiersmen like Tom Fitzpatrick to adapt. When he becomes a guide for some of the first Americans to emigrate to California, he faces new dangers even as his way of life is becoming obsolete.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E11 Good Night Sweet Charlotte Charlotte, an old friend of Lou's, comes to Rock Creek and stirs up bad memories of a man who had hurt them both. Lou distances herself from Kid, but when Charlotte turns up dead, Lou confronts her past. Meanwhile, Jimmy befriends a Lakota Indian.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E5 The Outlander Cheyenne's travels take him to a small town called Paradise Springs. Instead of a warm welcome, angry townspeople confront him and quickly run him out of town. However, perplexed by his cruel treatment, he returns to uncover the reason behind it.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E6 The Travelers The murder of a US Marshal forces Cheyenne to bring back the outlaw wanted for the crime. However, Cheyenne doesn't believe the man is guilty. On his way back with the fugitive, the father of the victim is hot on his trail.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E13 Death at Dawn When a member of a powerful gang of outlaws murders a local shopkeeper, the killer is sentenced to be hanged. The leader of the gang kidnaps Ben and holds him hostage in an attempt to gain the killer's freedom.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E31 The Prodigal A bank robber hides at the McCain Ranch and takes Lucas and Mark hostage. Problems arise when the gunman's mother shows up, believing he owns the ranch and Mark is her grandson. The truth comes out when more gunmen arrive.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E32 The Fourflusher Sharecropper Gabe Fenway enters his horse, Sapphire, in a race. His landlord, Jake Preston, bets Fenway that Mark's horse, Blueboy, will win. Preston wants Fenway's farm and bets $1000 against his whole year of crops. He will stop at nothing to win.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E33 The Jailbird Bessie Steel Weaver welcomes her husband, Farley, home after his release from prison. Lucas hires him as a hand believing he has changed his ways. However, when a murder occurs during a local robbery, suspicions are aroused.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E34 Meeting at Midnight Lucas' old Army buddy, Tom Benton, comes to North Fork raising a ruckus. Micah arrests him and Lucas bails him out. Benton, an undercover federal agent, wants to stay in jail to hopefully infiltrate a gang of bank robbers.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Friend Zone A shipment from Faith Cattle Company is in jeopardy when the truck gets stuck in a ditch. It's a race against the clock to get the cattle to the buyer or risk losing the deal. Bubba teams up with his father-in-law to build a custom grill prototype in hopes of launching a new business venture. Cody decides to sell a horse to help fund his dream home, but he receives an offer that is less than ideal. After getting relationship advice from Bubba and Cody, Booger ends up on a date with his best friend Ashley.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E5 Is It a Boy or a Girl? Before heading out for the day's work, Bubba notices one of his colts is missing, and the guys go searching for the young horse before it is injured. programme.desc: S1 E6 The Travelers The murder of a US Marshal forces Cheyenne to bring back the outlaw wanted for the crime. However, Cheyenne doesn't believe the man is guilty. On his way back with the fugitive, the father of the victim is hot on his trail.

programme.desc: S1 E13 Death at Dawn When a member of a powerful gang of outlaws murders a local shopkeeper, the killer is sentenced to be hanged. The leader of the gang kidnaps Ben and holds him hostage in an attempt to gain the killer's freedom.

programme.desc: S2 E31 The Prodigal A bank robber hides at the McCain Ranch and takes Lucas and Mark hostage. Problems arise when the gunman's mother shows up, believing he owns the ranch and Mark is her grandson. The truth comes out when more gunmen arrive.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E32 The Fourflusher Sharecropper Gabe Fenway enters his horse, Sapphire, in a race. His landlord, Jake Preston, bets Fenway that Mark's horse, Blueboy, will win. Preston wants Fenway's farm and bets $1000 against his whole year of crops. He will stop at nothing to win.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E33 The Jailbird Bessie Steel Weaver welcomes her husband, Farley, home after his release from prison. Lucas hires him as a hand believing he has changed his ways. However, when a murder occurs during a local robbery, suspicions are aroused.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E34 Meeting at Midnight Lucas' old Army buddy, Tom Benton, comes to North Fork raising a ruckus. Micah arrests him and Lucas bails him out. Benton, an undercover federal agent, wants to stay in jail to hopefully infiltrate a gang of bank robbers.

programme.title: Christmas in the Pines
programme.desc: Ariel thought she bought the perfect cottage for Christmas, but, through a mix-up, two offers were accepted on the house. As she battles Mark, the other buyer, Ariel realizes she may not only have found the perfect house, but also the perfect love.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E7 The Assailants When Senator Jim Borden visits North Fork, Marshal Micah Torrance receives a telegram stating an assassination attempt could be made on the senator's life. The plot begins to unfold as four gunman disguised as cavalrymen arrive with a Gatling gun.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E8 Mark's Rifle Marty Blair rides into North Fork to promote a circus coming out west from Ohio. Blair is soon under suspicion when there is an attempted robbery at the hotel. Mark finds it hard to believe that Blair is guilty, however, Lucas feels differently.

programme.title: Buffalo Keepers
programme.desc: S1 E1 Today, the buffalo is the quintessential symbol of strength, freedom, and the unspoiled American West. But in the late 1800s, the nation's buffalo were nearly wiped out by ruthless hide hunters. Those majestic herds, which once numbered in the tens of millions, were down to less than 500 animals. This is the story of the handful of determined men and women who mobilized to save the ones that were left in a last-ditch effort to stave off extinction. Ranchers like Charles and Mary Ann Goodnight rescued orphaned buffalo calves and built small herds. Former buffalo hunters like Buffalo Bill helped build public sympathy. And politicians like Theodore Roosevelt helped pass laws to protect the remaining animals. The effort would be a generational one, with buffalo herds carefully tended, bred, and passed down to new stewards when their old protectors passed away. Thanks to their efforts, there are an estimated 500,000 buffalo thundering across America's grasslands once again.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E3 Pinkerton Detectives Track a Killer After a bank robbery, two Pinkerton detectives join forces to track the notorious Missouri Kid. During a shootout, the Missouri Kid kills seasoned detective Charles Schumacher, leaving young George Dougherty to finish the job and avenge his death.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E8 The Many Faces of Charles Siringo Unable to apprehend the train-robbing Smith Brothers, Sheriff Doc Shores calls the Pinkerton Detective Agency for assistance. The agency sends Charles Siringo, an undercover specialist known for his unorthodox methods of capturing criminals.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E6 Christopher Gist: Unsung Hero of the First Frontier After mapping the rugged Ohio Country, frontiersman and surveyor Christopher Gist accepts a new mission: lead a young George Washington to a remote French fort in the Ohio wilderness on a diplomatic journey which may change the course of history.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E12 Song of Isiah Isiah Burke and his wife Rosemary are abolitionists who are trying to lead a group to freedom. Jimmy, who is visiting his sister, becomes involved with them but soon finds out that their tactics are too violent.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E7 Escape to Ponderosa Three deserters escape from an Army stockade and hide at the Ponderosa. When a captain comes looking for them, Ben soon realizes how the prisoners are being treated and resolves to confront his good friend in charge.

programme.title: War of the Wildcats
programme.desc: During the early days of the Oklahoma oil boom, a greedy, self-assured oilman and a quiet, yet determined cowboy fight for the rights to oil on Indian land. All the while a pretty schoolteacher steals both men's hearts.

programme.title: The Gambler
programme.desc: When a card shark receives a letter from a distant and troubled son, he travels to rescue the boy and his mother. During a train ride, the gambler meets a friendly, prideful young card player and shares his wisdom.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E14 Skull Lucas and Mark are separated on a hunting trip. During his search, Lucas enters Skull Ranch, a headquarters for outlaws. The gang forces him to help break out two members from jail. Lucas has no choice after he learns they've captured Mark as well.

programme.title: Christmas in the Pines
programme.desc: Ariel thought she bought the perfect cottage for Christmas, but, through a mix-up, two offers were accepted on the house. As she battles Mark, the other buyer, Ariel realizes she may not only have found the perfect house, but also the perfect love.

programme.desc: S1 E7 Escape to Ponderosa Three deserters escape from an Army stockade and hide at the Ponderosa. When a captain comes looking for them, Ben soon realizes how the prisoners are being treated and resolves to confront his good friend in charge.

programme.title: War of the Wildcats
programme.desc: During the early days of the Oklahoma oil boom, a greedy, self-assured oilman and a quiet, yet determined cowboy fight for the rights to oil on Indian land. All the while a pretty schoolteacher steals both men's hearts.

programme.title: The Gambler
programme.desc: When a card shark receives a letter from a distant and troubled son, he travels to rescue the boy and his mother. During a train ride, the gambler meets a friendly, prideful young card player and shares his wisdom.

programme.title: Black Fox
programme.desc: A former slave and his white blood brother have moved their families from the Carolinas to Texas. When the Civil War begins, their settlement is left unprotected from hostile Indian tribes and the former slave may be the only hope for peace.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E9 The Last Viking Gunnar Borgstrom stops to visit his relatives, the Cartwrights, on his way to Canada. Gunnar is hiding a dark secret and when little Joe's life is put in danger, the only way to save him is for Gunnar to come clean.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E10 The Trail Gang Ben hires Sam Jackson to help on a cattle drive. Jackson is really Outlaw Johnny Logan. Johnny signed for the drive since it was going near the town of Waycross, where he plans to kill the Waycross sheriff, who is his father.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E7 George Croghan: Frontier Peacemaker When Chief Pontiac organizes a coalition of Native American tribes to attack British forts, frontier trader George Croghan risks his life on a perilous journey into the wilderness to find Pontiac, negotiate a peace agreement, and prevent all-out war.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E12 Annie Oakley & Buffalo Bill's Wild West Showdown When Buffalo Bill adds female sharpshooter Lillian Smith to his Wild West show, it jeopardizes his relationship with the show's current star, Annie Oakley. As the rivalry between Annie and Lillian escalates, the future of the show is put at risk.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E1 Bat Masterson Leaves the West After leaving Dodge City, Bat Masterson takes a job as manager of Denver's Palace Theatre. There he falls in love with Emma Walter, a jugging virtuoso known as the Queen of Clubs, and begins to question his life as a gunslinger.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S7 E8 Pocketful of Stars In order to bypass sacred Shoshone burial grounds, Cheyenne scouts land for the railroad. Cheyenne's deal doesn't satisfy the railroad foreman and others. They try to eliminate him by any means possible, including using a Chinese girl to poison him.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E5 The Brother-In-Law Mark's uncle, Johnny Gibb, a famous rodeo rider, comes to visit. Mark idolizes his uncle, but Lucas soon discovers that Johnny is on the run from the law after robbing an express office, and is afraid that Johnny is a bad influence on young Mark.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E6 Eight Hours to Die Corrupt Judge Burton seeks justice against those who are responsible for the hanging of his son, including Lucas McCain, who caught him. When Burton discovers that Lucas has a son, he captures Lucas to make him watch Mark suffer the same punishment.

programme.title: Suddenly
programme.desc: Three gangsters converge on a small town and invade a family home on the top of a hill near the railroad station. They are planning to assassinate the President of the United States. - This classic suspense film will keep you on the edge of your seat.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E13 The Silent Knife Mark, a young mute boy, arrives in North Fork. When townspeople treat Mark badly because he cannot speak, Lucas and his son, Mark, befriend him. Desperate for cash, the boy steals $500 from a stagecoach line. Lucas convinces him to return the money.

programme.title: Vengeance Valley
programme.desc: A Colorado rancher contends with his two sons, one biological and the other adopted, who are fighting over control of the massive family property. Which brother will come out on top in this family battle for cash and cattle?

programme.title: Vengeance Valley
programme.desc: A Colorado rancher contends with his two sons, one biological and the other adopted, who are fighting over control of the massive family property. Which brother will come out on top in this family battle for cash and cattle?

programme.title: Christmas in Rockwell
programme.desc: Ex-child actor, Alyssa Strader, returns to her hometown to hide from the press after a movie flop. But when she meets local cinema owner Jake, will she be able to hide from the paparazzi, or will her new romantic relationship make front-page news?

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E10 Star Light, Star Bright As Christmas approaches, the riders fall victim to a con man, an old prospector named Cyrus, who promises them a half share in a gold mine. The riders help an impoverished family by celebrating the holiday with them.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E29 The Hawk Mark finally captures a hawk that he has been chasing but he encounters a rattlesnake in the process. When a stranger quickly comes to his rescue, a grateful Mark invites the man to the ranch, unaware he is a fugitive on the run from the law.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E30 Three-Legged Terror A troubled 18-year-old named Johnny Clover ransacks the North Fork Schoolhouse, stealing art supplies. Lucas later tries to help Johnny, but he lives with a controlling uncle who proves to be difficult to deal with.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E5 The Masterson Brothers Part 1 After Marshal Ed Masterson is shot while breaking up a barroom brawl, he hastily bans all firearms in Dodge City. Ed's swift proclamation is met with disdain by most townsfolk, including his own brothers, and places an even larger target on his back.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E6 The Masterson Brothers Part 2 After Marshal Ed Masterson is gunned down in Dodge City, his youngest brother, James, decides to follow in his footsteps and become a lawman. But when James' life is threatened, middle brother Bat Masterson races back from Arizona to protect his kin.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E12 Fury at Rio Hondo As Cheyenne travels through Mexico, he finds himself in an area plagued by political unrest from revolutionaries. He encounters a blonde pickpocket singer in Rio Hondo who happens to be with a man who owes him money from a cattle deal.

programme.title: Christmas in Wolf Creek
programme.desc: It's Samantha and Austin to the rescue as they track a wayward reindeer in time to save the town's Christmas Eve play, but will this adventure bring them closer together, or create more tension than their new relationship can weather?

programme.title: Cavalry Charge
programme.desc: When two brothers each decide to fight on opposite sides in the Civil War, they never dreamed they would need to reunite and fight together. It is the only chance they have, if they hope to survive a brutal Indian attack.

programme.title: The Gun and the Pulpit
programme.desc: The captivating tale of a smooth-talking gunslinger posing as a preacher to hide from his enemies. He ends up bringing hope to his parishioners and law-and-order to a town terrorized by crooks.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E20 The Angry Sky Cheyenne sets out on the trail of Black Jack, an escaped robber and murderer. However, Black Jack traps and shoots him, leaving him for dead. A woman finds Cheyenne and takes him to a remote cabin, just in time for a winter storm to set in.

programme.title: Christmas in Rockwell
programme.desc: Ex-child actor, Alyssa Strader, returns to her hometown to hide from the press after a movie flop. But when she meets local cinema owner Jake, will she be able to hide from the paparazzi, or will her new romantic relationship make front-page news?

programme.desc: S1 E12 Fury at Rio Hondo As Cheyenne travels through Mexico, he finds himself in an area plagued by political unrest from revolutionaries. He encounters a blonde pickpocket singer in Rio Hondo who happens to be with a man who owes him money from a cattle deal.

programme.title: Christmas in Wolf Creek
programme.desc: It's Samantha and Austin to the rescue as they track a wayward reindeer in time to save the town's Christmas Eve play, but will this adventure bring them closer together, or create more tension than their new relationship can weather?

programme.title: Cavalry Charge
programme.desc: When two brothers each decide to fight on opposite sides in the Civil War, they never dreamed they would need to reunite and fight together. It is the only chance they have, if they hope to survive a brutal Indian attack.

programme.title: The Gun and the Pulpit
programme.desc: The captivating tale of a smooth-talking gunslinger posing as a preacher to hide from his enemies. He ends up bringing hope to his parishioners and law-and-order to a town terrorized by crooks.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E11 Long Gun from Tucson A killer, John Holliver, and his followers come to North Fork looking for revenge. All of the residents are terrified since they ran him out of town five years earlier. Lucas, now acting marshal, realizes that he must face Holliver and his men alone.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E6 Misty Makes a Match The cowboys are in for a busy week when they're called upon to capture a wild hog that has been getting into a neighbor's garden. They also search a swamp for a calf that goes missing when they move their herd. Cody and Misty get serious about finding a name for their baby boy, so they study their family trees for inspiration. After a disastrous attempt at Internet dating, Booger takes one more shot at dating and agrees to go on a blind date that Misty arranges. Will he finally find a woman that understands the cowboy way of life?

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E7 Frost Moves In Bubba and Cody rush to get their grass planted before the first frost, but they need a bigger tractor to get the job done. Bubba ends up building a horse stall for a neighbor in exchange for the use of his tractor. Booger's relationship with Jaclyn gets serious, and he meets her son for the first time. Cody and Booger rescue a cow from a huge dirt pit, and Cody receives a load of dirt for the foundation of his dream home. Finally, Kaley surprises Bubba with the news that their baby girl is going to arrive sooner than expected.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E9 The Most Amazing Man Wade Randall comes to North Fork and mesmerizes children with big stories of his past gun battles with outlaws. Lucas suspects he is all talk and exposes the truth after Randall refuses to accept a shootout challenge.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E10 Squeeze Play A land speculator named Willard Prescott contacts Lucas about buying his land as the railroad is fast approaching the area. He bribes Lucas and when he refuses, Prescott makes it clear he will stop at nothing to get his land, one way or the other.

programme.title: Christmas in the Wilds
programme.desc: When bush pilot Buck Johnson's plane is grounded after an avalanche rescue mission deep in the Rocky Mountains. Jessica and Buck decide they must each make the dangerous trek through the wilderness to be together for their first Christmas.

programme.title: Love in Wolf Creek
programme.desc: On the eve of a big-city donor's visit, Samantha Groves, director of the wildlife center, teams up with local rancher Austin Spencer and risks the future of her fledging rescue center to find and save a white wolf with life-threatening injuries.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E7 Decision Cheyenne learns of an impending attack against a cavalry troop traveling through Indian territory. Going against the commanding officer's route, he leads a mutiny to avoid a certain massacre.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Storm Riders The hired hand of a wealthy landowner ambushes and injures Cheyenne while he drives a herd of horses for a local rancher, on what he thought was open territory. As his boss nurses him back to health, Cheyenne gets more than he bargained for.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E1 Showdown A young bank robber decides to get a job at the Ponderosa with the Cartwrights in an attempt to prevent the local sheriff from learning the whereabouts of his accomplices, known as the feared Pardo gang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E35 Nora An old flame of Lucas' comes to North Fork. After Lucas learns she is sick and her deceased husband spent all her money, he goes to help. However, all is not as it seems as she didn't come alone, and Lucas' good deed involves him in a murder.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E36 The Hangman Lucas arrives at Eban Muchen's ranch to deliver supplies. He finds Muchen's body and hired hand, Voleny Adams, right next to him. Adams denies he killed Muchen, but no one in town believes the ex-convict and want him to hang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E1 Trail of Hate Three bank robbers come to the McCain Ranch and force Lucas into helping them rob the North Fork Bank. One robber stays behind to guard Mark while the other two take Lucas to town. They threaten to kill Mark, unless Lucas cooperates with the gunmen.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E2 Woman from Hog Ridge When Lucas and Mark catch two young men stealing a horse, Lucas is forced into a shootout. He captures one of the men, but Ma Boyle's son is killed in the gunfight. Soon after the killing, the Boyle clan comes to hang the person responsible.

After a disastrous attempt at Internet dating, Booger takes one more shot at dating and agrees to go on a blind date that Misty arranges. programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes unravels a murder involving a locked room with no key, a domestic disagreement and a set of animal tracks.

programme.title: Boys Town
programme.desc: The devout but iron-willed Father Flanagan (Spencer Tracy) leads a community called Boys Town, a different sort of juvenile detention facility where, instead of being treated as underage criminals, the boys are shepherded into making themselves better people. But hard-nosed petty thief and pool shark Whitey Marsh (Mickey Rooney), the impulsive and violent younger brother of an imprisoned murderer, might be too much for the good father's tough-love system.

programme.title: In the Good Old Summertime
programme.desc: In this musical romance, lovely Veronica Fisher (Judy Garland) lands a job in Otto Oberkugen's (S.Z. Sakall) music store in turn-of-the-century Chicago. Though the other employees like her, including Otto's clumsy nephew Hickey (Buster Keaton), salesman Andrew Larkin (Van Johnson) -- who is threatened by her competition, and secretly attracted to her -- greets her coolly. Each of them is carrying on a romantic correspondence with an as-yet-to-be-met pen pal. They are both in for a surprise.

programme.title: On Moonlight Bay
programme.desc: A teenage tomboy (Doris Day) with a fun family makes music with a college man (Gordon MacRae) in circa-World War I Indiana.

programme.title: The Wild Westerners
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (James Philbrook) and his wife (Nancy Kovack) bring Union gold east through outlaws and Indians.

programme.title: Westbound
programme.desc: A former Union officer, John Hayes (Randolph Scott) now manages a stagecoach company. However, Clay Putnam (Andrew Duggan), a businessman still loyal to the South, is intent on robbing the coaches operated by Hayes, which transport gold to the North from California. Hoping to heist the treasure as a way to revive the Confederacy, Putnam also has a grudge against Hayes, since his wife, Norma (Virginia Mayo), was once involved with the handsome Union soldier.

programme.title: Tribute to a Bad Man
programme.desc: When hot-headed rancher Jeremy Rodock (James Cagney) is shot by rustlers stealing his horses, cowboy Steve Millar (Don Dubbins) saves his life by cleaning his bullet wound. A grateful Rodock offers him a job. Ranch hand McNulty (Stephen McNally), beaten and fired by Rodock for flirting with Rodock's wife (Irene Papas), joins forces with the rustlers to once again target his old boss. After another herd is stolen, Rodock tracks down the thieves to wreak a bloody revenge.

programme.title: The Man Who Came to Dinner
programme.desc: While on a speaking tour in Ohio, opinionated and arrogant radio personality Sheridan Whiteside (Monty Woolley) injures himself slipping on ice and becomes an unexpected houseguest for a prominent area family, the Stanleys. Whiteside proceeds to make brash proclamations and offer his unsolicited advice to the family members. When a romance begins between Whiteside's assistant, Maggie Cutler (Bette Davis), and a local reporter, Bert Jefferson (Richard Travis), he interferes with that as well.

programme.title: Fitzwilly
programme.desc: In this clever 1960s comedy, tireless and loyal butler Fitzwilly (Dick Van Dyke) hides from his eccentric spinster boss, Victoria Woodhouse (Edith Evans), the fact that she has been bankrupt since her father died. Through wily schemes with his fellow servants, he creates one racket, swindle or con after another to maintain the household and fund his employer's frivolous philanthropy. When new secretary Juliet (Barbara Feldon) is hired on, Fitzwilly's life gets even more complicated.

programme.title: Christmas Eve
programme.desc: Matilda Reid (Ann Harding) is in danger of being declared senile at the urging of her nephew, Phillip (Reginald Denny). To keep him from controlling her estate, Matilda must find her three adopted sons, who left home long ago. One of them, Michael (George Brent), lives in New York, where he's incurred a $75,000 debt. Another, fugitive Mario (George Raft), is hiding in South America. The last, Jonathan (Randolph Scott), is a small-time cowboy. All three must come home to save Matilda's fortune.

programme.title: In Old Cheyenne
programme.desc: Newspaper reporter Steve Blane (Roy Rogers) is sent to Cheyenne, Wyo., to write about frontier outlaw Arapahoe Brown (George "Gabby" Hayes). But as Blane spends time in the cow town, he realizes that the conventional wisdom is all wrong. Arapahoe has been made a scapegoat for crimes perpetrated by power-hungry rancher Sam Drummond (George Rosener). As Blane attempts to report the truth, he finds himself caught in the middle of a dangerous feud between cattlemen and settlers.

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A young doctor asks Holmes to investigate the strange behavior of his benefactor.

programme.title: Paid Programming
programme.desc: Paid programming.

programme.title: The Lonesome Trail
programme.desc: A group of conniving land-grabbers is deterred from further evil by a Western Robin Hood armed with a bow and arrow.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick, an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible; his simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes and Watson try to trace an undetectable murder weapon.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Railroad executive Homer Bedloe arrives in Hooterville with a railroad tycoon, who is determined to purchase the Cannonball.

programme.title: The Man Who Came to Dinner
programme.desc: While on a speaking tour in Ohio, opinionated and arrogant radio personality Sheridan Whiteside (Monty Woolley) injures himself slipping on ice and becomes an unexpected houseguest for a prominent area family, the Stanleys. programme.title: Tribute to a Bad Man
programme.desc: When hot-headed rancher Jeremy Rodock (James Cagney) is shot by rustlers stealing his horses, cowboy Steve Millar (Don Dubbins) saves his life by cleaning his bullet wound. A grateful Rodock offers him a job. Ranch hand McNulty (Stephen McNally), beaten and fired by Rodock for flirting with Rodock's wife (Irene Papas), joins forces with the rustlers to once again target his old boss. After another herd is stolen, Rodock tracks down the thieves to wreak a bloody revenge.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: The honorable Calem Ware (Randolph Scott), marshal of the Wild West boomtown of Medicine Bend, attempts to defuse the simmering tensions in his rapidly growing and increasingly violent town, as a greedy businessman (Warner Anderson) hires a sinister black-gloved gunman (Michael Pate) to take care of his problems with the marshal for good. Meanwhile, a traveling song-and-dance troupe arrives in town, bearing Ware's lost love, Tally (Angela Lansbury), who holds the secret to his violent past.

programme.title: Holiday Inn
programme.desc: In this Irving Berlin musical, Jim (Bing Crosby) and Lila are members of a performing trio who plan to quit and run a country hotel. When Lila says she has fallen in love with the dancer in the act, Ted (Fred Astaire), Jim leaves town with a broken heart. After turning the inn into a holidays-only live entertainment venue, Jim winds up booking -- and falling for -- Linda (Marjorie Reynolds). But when Ted shows up at the place after being dumped by Lila, he too sets his sights on beautiful Linda.

programme.title: All That Heaven Allows
programme.desc: Predicated on a May-December romance. The difference here is that the woman, attractive widow Cary Scott (Jane Wyman), is considerably older than the man, handsome gardener-landscaper Ron Kirby (Rock Hudson). Throwing conventional behavior to the winds and facing social ostracism, Cary pursues her romance with Ron, who is unjustly perceived as a fortune-hunter by Cary's friends and family -- especially her priggish brother Ned (William Reynolds).

programme.title: The World of Henry Orient
programme.desc: While trying to seduce a married woman (Paula Prentiss), egotistical concert pianist Henry Orient (Peter Sellers) is interrupted by two precocious schoolgirls, Valerie (Tippy Walker) and Marian (Merrie Spaeth). At first he thinks nothing of it, but as he sees them more often, he becomes convinced they're spies for his lover's husband. The girls, meanwhile, have found out who he is, and Valerie insists she's in love. She starts a scrapbook, which her mother finds and, of course, misconstrues.

programme.title: The Girl from San Lorenzo
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho set out to clear their names in a series of stage robberies committed by two thugs who are impersonating them.

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A down-at-the-heels pawnbroker is offered a large sum for copying the encyclopedia for four hours a day.

programme.title: Dough and Dynamite
programme.desc: Charlie and another waiter have to become bakers when the regular cooks go on strike.

programme.title: Fury at Gunsight Pass
programme.desc: One bank robber (David Brian) double-crosses another (Neville Brand), giving the undertaker and others a chance at the loot.

programme.title: Holiday Inn
programme.desc: In this Irving Berlin musical, Jim (Bing Crosby) and Lila are members of a performing trio who plan to quit and run a country hotel. When Lila says she has fallen in love with the dancer in the act, Ted (Fred Astaire), Jim leaves town with a broken heart. After turning the inn into a holidays-only live entertainment venue, Jim winds up booking -- and falling for -- Linda (Marjorie Reynolds). programme.title: Fury at Gunsight Pass
programme.desc: One bank robber (David Brian) double-crosses another (Neville Brand), giving the undertaker and others a chance at the loot.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: The honorable Calem Ware (Randolph Scott), marshal of the Wild West boomtown of Medicine Bend, attempts to defuse the simmering tensions in his rapidly growing and increasingly violent town, as a greedy businessman (Warner Anderson) hires a sinister black-gloved gunman (Michael Pate) to take care of his problems with the marshal for good. Meanwhile, a traveling song-and-dance troupe arrives in town, bearing Ware's lost love, Tally (Angela Lansbury), who holds the secret to his violent past.

programme.title: Two Guys From Texas
programme.desc: Song-and-dance men Steve Carroll (Dennis Morgan) and Danny Foster (Jack Carson) walk to a Texas dude ranch after their car runs out of gas. The team's friend, singer Maggie Reed (Penny Edwards), gets the boys a job. With their auto stolen, the two settle into ranch life. While Danny consults with Dr. Straeger (Fred Clark) to conquer his fear of animals, Steve courts ranch owner Joan Winston (Dorothy Malone). When their stolen car is used in a robbery, the duo must then find the real culprits.

programme.title: Bright Eyes
programme.desc: Having lost her father to a plane crash, 5-year-old Shirley (Shirley Temple) and her mother, Mary (Lois Wilson), live with the Smythe family, for whom Mary serves as a domestic. With the exception of Uncle Ned (Charles Sellon), the Smythes don't much care for Shirley, and she greatly prefers spending time with her godfather, pilot James Merritt (James Dunn). When Mary is killed in a car accident, the distraught Shirley becomes the object of a bitter custody battle between James and Ned.

programme.title: The Trouble With Angels
programme.desc: Mary (Hayley Mills) and her friend, Rachel (June Harding), are new students at St. Francis Academy, a boarding school run by the iron fist of Mother Superior (Rosalind Russell). The immature teens grow bored and begin playing pranks on both the unsuspecting nuns and their unpleasant classmates, becoming a constant thorn in Mother Superior's side. However, as the years pass, Mary and Rachel slowly mature and begin to see the nuns in a different light.

programme.title: Bell, Book and Candle
programme.desc: In the late 1950s, Gillian Holroyd (Kim Novak) is a modern-day witch living in New York City's Greenwich Village. When she encounters charming publisher Shepherd Henderson (James Stewart), she decides to make him hers by casting a love spell. Gillian takes added pleasure in doing so because Henderson is engaged to her old college rival (Janice Rule). However, Gillian finds herself actually falling for Shepherd, which poses a problem: She will lose her powers if she falls in love.

programme.title: The Man From Utah
programme.desc: One day, John Weston (John Wayne) helps stop a bank robbery. George Higgins (George Hayes), the town's grateful marshal, asks Weston for his help in solving another crime. It seems someone at a touring rodeo show is killing the top riders before they can take home the trophy -- and the prize money. Weston agrees to investigate and works his way into the show, which is run by the shady Spike Barton (Edward Peil). As Weston gets closer to the truth, he finds himself in even greater danger.

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Professor Moriarty follows Holmes to Switzerland and battles him to the death at the edge of Reichenbach Falls.

programme.title: Bright Eyes
programme.desc: Having lost her father to a plane crash, 5-year-old Shirley (Shirley Temple) and her mother, Mary (Lois Wilson), live with the Smythe family, for whom Mary serves as a domestic. With the exception of Uncle Ned (Charles Sellon), the Smythes don't much care for Shirley, and she greatly prefers spending time with her godfather, pilot James Merritt (James Dunn). When Mary is killed in a car accident, the distraught Shirley becomes the object of a bitter custody battle between James and Ned.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: When the people of Dodge City capture the brother of gang leader Marie Burden in a robbery, Marie confronts Earp, willing to do whatever it takes to free him.

programme.title: Ministry - Your Words Have Power with Joyce Meyer
programme.desc: Your words hold incredible power; today, Joyce reveals how the things you say can impact your life in profound ways.

programme.title: Word of God Ministries
programme.desc: Pastor James McMenis and his wife Chrissy are dedicated to winning the lost to Jesus and making disciples of the saved. Their goal is to bring clarity to the Word of God, making it life-applicable to people everywhere.

programme.title: The Catholic Mass
programme.desc: The Heart of the nation Sunday mass brings the beauty and traditions of the Catholic faith.

programme.title: Perry Stone
programme.desc: Religious teachings from Perry Stone.

programme.title: Paid Programming
programme.desc: Paid programming.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: When a newspaper editor drums up anti-Northern sentiment by launching a smear campaign aimed at Earp, the marshal takes a leave of absence to confront a Texas gang working with the editor.

programme.title: Across the Wide Missouri
programme.desc: Tough trapper Flint Mitchell (Clark Gable) is a tenacious survivor in the unforgiving wilderness of the West. Determined to stay on the good side of the local Blackfoot tribe, Flint is intent on marrying Kamiah (Maria Elena Marques), the beautiful daughter of Ironshirt (Ricardo Montalban) -- especially since this union would allow him to freely pursue his trade in the region. Struggling to win the approval of the protective Ironshirt, Flint finds himself truly falling for Kamiah.

programme.title: Susan Slept Here
programme.desc: A penniless Hollywood scriptwriter agrees to look after a rebellious teenage girl at Christmas in order to help with his research for film about juvenile delinquency. The troublesome girl causes all kinds of problems, not the least of which is setting the writer's girlfriend on fire with jealousy.

programme.title: Bonanza Town
programme.desc: The Durango Kid learns that a supposedly dead outlaw is alive and well and in cahoots with a corrupt town boss.

programme.title: Young at Heart
programme.desc: Gregory Tuttle (Robert Keith), a widowed musician, is the father of three extraordinarily gifted daughters, Laurie (Doris Day), Fran (Dorothy Malone) and Amy (Elisabeth Fraser), all of whom are facing different romantic troubles. The arrival of two handsome musicians, Alex Burke (Gig Young) and Barney Sloan (Frank Sinatra), who have been invited by Gregory to board at the house while working on a new musical, further complicates the daughters' love lives.

programme.title: Father's Little Dividend
programme.desc: A year after dealing with a surprise engagement in Father of the Bride, Stanley Banks (Spencer Tracy) and his wife, Ellie (Joan Bennett), are in for another shock when they find their daughter Kay (Elizabeth Taylor) is now pregnant. Not ready to be a grandfather, Stanley keeps quiet while everyone else fawns over the mother-to-be and bothers her about baby names and nursery decorations. Ironically, his silence makes him the person Kay turns to the most for help, which in turn helps him.

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Watson finds Holmes still alive three years after his reported death at Moriarty's hands.

programme.title: Across the Wide Missouri
programme.desc: Tough trapper Flint Mitchell (Clark Gable) is a tenacious survivor in the unforgiving wilderness of the West. Determined to stay on the good side of the local Blackfoot tribe, Flint is intent on marrying Kamiah (Maria Elena Marques), the beautiful daughter of Ironshirt (Ricardo Montalban) -- especially since this union would allow him to freely pursue his trade in the region. Struggling to win the approval of the protective Ironshirt, Flint finds himself truly falling for Kamiah.

programme.title: Trail Street
programme.desc: Legendary lawman Bat Masterson (Randolph Scott) is called to rural Kansas to defend farmers from ruthless cattlemen. Joining Masterson in his efforts to clean up a lawless town are a couple of locals: Masterson's old chum Billy Burn and landowner Allen Harper (Robert Ryan). But ranch owner Logan Maury proves to be a more than formidable opponent. He'll stop at nothing, including murder, to turn the farmers' fields into grazing grounds for his cattle.

programme.title: Abandoned Dreams
programme.desc: The abandoned boat dilemma is one of the most frustrating and alarming issues facing British Columbia's coastal communities. Reaching the end of their life cycle, with limited disposal options and almost no way to track ownership, hundreds of old boats are being left to rot, and sink or drift onto beaches and shorelines around our province. The result is a province-wide problem that affect coastal navigation, tourism and the environment. Abandoned Dreams looks into the root causes of this derel.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: Traveling with nomad Michael Ladden and his Drive the Globe expedition vehicle; heading to Utah to go dual sport riding; a look at the Glaciers to Geysers Trek: A Tale of Fire and Ice.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: The team travels to Oregon for the Bend Overland Expo and visits places like Crater Lake National Park; testing the Opus OP15 off-road trailer which sleeps four and has a full outdoor kitchen and solar power to live off-grid.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: Traveling to Whistler Canada to go mountain biking at North America's premiere mountain bike Park and going four wheeling; an inside look at project Toyota Tundra build for overlanding.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: Hitting Alaska to go four wheeling, helicopter to a glacier to go dog sledding, then trying ziplining and taking a train ride; building a used 2017 Toyota 4Runner for overlanding, and showing why this SUV is so popular.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: The team travels to Montana to go off-roading; Ken Faught takes flight and lands on a backcountry grass strip near Glacier National Park; testing Forest River's Nobo 16.6 Beast Mode off-road trailer.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: The team hits Yellowstone National Park to see some natural wonders; testing vintage trailer works XTR off-road trailer and introducing Greg Amendola, a legend in the world of vehicle electronics.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: The ORTTV team travels to Idaho to drive UTVs and ride the latest electric motorcycles; touring Pro Moto Billet where Wyatt Faught did a summer engineering internship; testing a Hiker Trailer built specifically for off-road.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: The team tackles extreme terrain in Utah before breaking down and heading back to California for some quick repairs; we return to Utah with a new crew and hit infamous places like Swingarm City, Cathedral Valley, Monument Valley and more.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: The ORTTV crew travels to Nelson Ghost Town outside of Las Vegas and shows you an inside look of a Ford Bronco Raptor build for overland; we also give a recap of our favorite moments during our 10,000-mile Alaska trip.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: The ORTTV crew tests a Field Van Mercedes Sprinter on a four-state trip through the West Coast; Ken Faught travels to Maui to drive UTVs and then heads to the desert to ride some electric dirt bikes and check out Tim Robel's expedition vehicle.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: We head to Sand Hallow State Park in Utah to go rock crawling with the national champ; Rob and Christjen Johnson test electric motorcycles in upstate New York; we head to Cabo San Lucas to explore this special part of Mexico in UTVs.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: We go overlanding with a $150,000 Jeep and then show you the maintenance tips for your off-road trailer; accessories for transporting your dirt bike, ATV or UTV in a truck, van or toy hauler trailer.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: Exploring the world of adventure motorcycles and showing the Editor's Choice for Must-Have Off-Road Products; a few surprises that will make you want to start planning an amazing off-road travel adventure.

programme.title: My Classic Car
programme.desc: From the rare and exotic to the extreme and wacky, Dennis Gage spotlights all things automotive, traveling the country to find the cars and events that spark America's love affair with the automobile.

programme.title: My Classic Car
programme.desc: My Classic Car is a weekly television program that captures America's Love affair with the automobile! Dennis Gage, the handlebar mustachioed host, takes you along for the ride and keeps it entertaining with his unique perspective and enthusiasm for all things automotive. This show has something for everyone. From daily-drivers to Dusenberg's - from local cruise-ins to the most prestigious car shows in the world, this program covers it all!

programme.title: Cover Girl
programme.desc: (1944) Rita Hayworth and Gene Kelly star in Charles Vidor's Technicolor comedy musical about a chorus girl's rise to fame. Featuring songs and a score from Jerome Kern and Ira Gershwin.

programme.title: Dead of Night
programme.desc: (1945) Five uncanny tales of the supernatural in one eerie package, the most famous starring ventriloquist Michael Redgrave and a deadly dummy. Prepare to be spooked.

programme.title: Anastasia
programme.desc: (1956) Historical drama. The Oscar-winning Ingrid Bergman stars as an amnesiac refugee who Yul Brynner tries to pass off as the daughter of the murdered Tsar of Russia, Nicholas II.

programme.title: Dr Who and the Daleks
programme.desc: (1965) A spin-off of the cult television series starring Peter Cushing. Backyard-inventor Dr Who finds himself stuck on the irradiated planet Skaro, home of the cold and metallic Daleks.

programme.title: Rosaline
programme.desc: (2022) Literary romcom with Kaitlyn Dever and Isabela Merced. This is the story of Juliet's cousin who gets dumped by Romeo at the start of Shakespeare's play... and she's not too pleased.

programme.title: Mrs Harris Goes to Paris
programme.desc: (2022) Lesley Manville stars as a cleaner who saves up and heads to Paris to get herself a Dior couture dress, in director Anthony Fabian's fabulous, Oscar-nominated period comedy drama.

programme.title: American Gangster
programme.desc: (2007) True crime thriller directed by Ridley Scott. An outcast New York cop (Russell Crowe) is charged with bringing down entrepreneurial Harlem drug lord Frank Lucas (Denzel Washington).

programme.title: Thief
programme.desc: (1971) Crime thriller starring Richard Crenna. A recently paroled thief must do one last job to pay off old debts. But can he get away with it and build a life with his new girlfriend?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Henry VIII and His Six Wives
programme.desc: (1972) Historical drama with Keith Michell as Henry VIII, nobly supported by Donald Pleasance, Charlotte Rampling and Jane Asher. The dying monarch reviews his own life.

programme.title: The Desert Fox
programme.desc: (1951) Drama. James Mason stars in Henry Hathaway's sympathetic portrait of Field Marshal Erwin Rommel in the final years of his life during the Second World War. With Jessica Tandy.

programme.title: The Lavender Hill Mob
programme.desc: (1951) Classic Ealing comedy starring Alec Guinness as a mild-mannered bank clerk who assembles a gang to hijack a million quid's worth of gold. Which is when their problems really start...

programme.title: Daleks Invasion Earth 2150 A.D.
programme.desc: (1966) A sci-fi classic with Peter Cushing. Dr Who travels to the future only to find the Daleks have conquered the Earth! Can he stop them nuking the planet's core? With Bernard Cribbins.

programme.title: Oblivion
programme.desc: (2013) Sci-fi action-mystery set on a war-ravaged planet Earth that's been largely abandoned by humanity. With Tom Cruise, Andrea Riseborough, Olga Kurylenko and Morgan Freeman.

programme.title: Good Luck to You, Leo Grande
programme.desc: (2022) Drama starring Emma Thompson as a recently widowed, retired teacher who has a sexual bucket list she wants to get around to now that she has the time and, perhaps, even the energy.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout
programme.desc: (2018) Tom Cruise stars in part six of the action-thriller series. His mission: to stop terrorists from getting their hands on nuclear bombs and unleashing global devastation.

programme.title: The Outsiders
programme.desc: (1983) Francis Ford Coppola's seminal brat pack coming-of-age crime drama with Tom Cruise, Patrick Swayze, Ralph Macchio, Matt Dillon and Rob Lowe. Two teenage tribes go to war in Tulsa.

programme.title: Hue & Cry

programme.title: Mysterious Island

programme.title: Mr Popper's Penguins
programme.desc: (2011) Family comedy. Jim Carrey stars as a work-obsessed New York property developer whose life is turned upside down when he receives a crate containing six live penguins.

programme.title: Midway

programme.title: The Menu

programme.title: Nightmare Alley
programme.desc: (2021) Guillermo del Toro's star-studded carny thriller with Bradley Cooper and Cate Blanchett. Can a chancer with a dark past use clairvoyancy to fleece rich New Yorkers out of a fortune?

programme.title: The Vourdalak
programme.desc: (2023) Darkly comic Gothic horror about the travails of a foppish emissary of the King of France in a gloomy forest inhabited by a very odd family. With Kacey Mottet Klein. In French/subs.
